Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ► son of Shaphat (שָׁפָט) from Abel Meholah (אָבֵל מְחֹולָה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: in accordance to the time of tomorrow; hence: = a reference to the time exactly 24 hours after a particular event takes place
= a reference to the day after the current day
= unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 ephah (אֵיפָה)
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour
= unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 ephah (אֵיפָה)

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= opening in a wall

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state in which a countable entity is four in number

Node.gloss: to suffer from a skin disease|to be affected by mildew
Node.definition: = state in which humans suffer from a condition that affects the skin, which probably covers diseases such as psoriasis, favus, leucoderma; ► a person who suffers from this disease is considered ritually unclean, and therefore unable to participate in worship; ≈ regarded as infectious, and seen as a curse and a punishment from God
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: to fall; hence: = action by which humans leave the group to which they belong and join another group, which is often seen as the enemy
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to keep alive|to restore to life
Node.definition: = to cause an object to become or remain alive and well; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in most cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: a camp; hence: = a relatively large group of people, such as nomads or soldiers, moving from one camping place to another
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: a man ... his brother > one ... each other
Node.definition: = expression denoting a situation in which two people or objects that are regarded as masculine are involved in a reciprocal event
= causative action by which humans obtain the service of other humans for a limited amount of time and in return for payment
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= member of ethnic group inhabiting Canaan (כְּנַעַן) before arrival of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ◄ regarded as descendants of Heth (חֵת)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see עַיִר (עַיִר) female see אָתֹון (אָתֹון)
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to suffer from a skin disease|to be affected by mildew
Node.definition: = state in which humans suffer from a condition that affects the skin, which probably covers diseases such as psoriasis, favus, leucoderma; ► a person who suffers from this disease is considered ritually unclean, and therefore unable to participate in worship; ≈ regarded as infectious, and seen as a curse and a punishment from God
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= information that one has been commissioned to pass on to other people
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

see אֹור (אֹור)|= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
literally: (an event) finds (people); = process by which humans eventually undergo a certain event, ◄ as if that event had been searching for them
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= a person responsible for guarding the entrance of a town or building

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= set of particles marking an object or event as a subset of a larger group which has been singled out from among the rest

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

= domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see עַיִר (עַיִר) female see אָתֹון (אָתֹון)
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= a person responsible for guarding the entrance of a town or building

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen by others, ► in order to be safe from danger or to attack someone else

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a countable entity is five in number

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a large group of people

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a large group of people

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
literally: a camp; hence: = a relatively large group of people, such as nomads or soldiers, moving from one camping place to another
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= process by which humans or animals are overcome by a sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety resulting in a frenzied hurry to run away
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 ephah (אֵיפָה)
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour
= unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 ephah (אֵיפָה)

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities give someone else a certain responsibility or position of authority with regards to an object, a group of people, or an entire land or nation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 ephah (אֵיפָה)

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed
= unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 ephah (אֵיפָה)
= finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour
literally: in accordance to the time of tomorrow; hence: = a reference to the time exactly 24 hours after a particular event takes place
= a reference to the day after the current day

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= opening in a wall

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
